intro: Kirganelia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate kirganelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
